document.docAuthor: Boyko, Christopher B., Williams, Jason D. & Shields, Jeffrey D.
document.masterDocTitle: Parasites (Isopoda: Epicaridea and Nematoda) from ghost and mud shrimp (Decapoda: Axiidea and Gebiidea) with descriptions of a new genus and a new species of bopyrid isopod and clarification of Pseudione Kossmann, 1881

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Parasites (Isopoda: Epicaridea and Nematoda) from ghost and mud shrimp (Decapoda: Axiidea and Gebiidea) with descriptions of a new genus and a new species of bopyrid isopod and clarification of Pseudione Kossmann, 1881

bibRefCitation.author: Cornalia
bibRefCitation.refString: Cornalia, E. & Panceri, P. (1861) Osservazioni zoologiche ed anatomiche sopra un nuovo genere di isopodi sedentarii (Gyge branchialis). Memorie delle Reale Accademia delle Scienze di Torino, ser. 2, 19, 85 - 118, pls. 1 - 2.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Not
Gyge branchialis
— Pandey, 1990 : 494–494, figs. 1, 2 ( India , infesting
Macrobrachium birmanicum choprai (Tiwari, 1949)
=
M . gangeticum Bate, 1868
) (almost certainly a species of
Probopyrus Giard & Bonnier, 1888
).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined
.
Italy :
2 ovigerous females ( 9.7–10.1 mm ) not affiliated with any host, 1 ovigerous female ( 9.3 mm ), 1 mature male ( 3.3 mm ), ex right branchial chamber of female
Upogebia stellata
( 14.3 mm CL), Naples Aquarium , coll. unknown,
17 Nov 1890
( NMV J71549 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution . Denmark , United Kingdom , France , Spain , Portugal , Italy , Algeria , Croatia , Romania , and Russia .

Hosts .
Upogebia deltaura (Leach, 1816)
,
U . pusilla (Petagna, 1792)
( type host),
U . stellata ( Montagu, 1808 )
, and
U . tipica (Nardo, 1869)
.
Remarks . Although old, these specimens are exceptionally well-preserved and match prior descriptions (e.g., Bourdon 1968 ).
